website_summaries.verdict: Provides a mixture of hex bar and high hex bar features, making it one of the more versatile options you'll find.
pros: Considering its price, you'll appreciate the fact that it's an extremely sturdy hex bar with a weight capacity of 750 pounds
Should work with all 2-inch weight plates
Includes a large cage area that means many different sizes of people can use it comfortably
cons: Welds on the stress points of the bar may give out when you have a lot of weight attached

customer_reviews.title: Super versatile. Unless your a powerlifter this is all ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing does the job. Super versatile. Unless your a powerlifter this is all you need. I went with the black powdercoat model. For $100 you can't go wrong. It came in banged up from shipping but who cares. It's for building muscle. Doesn't need to look perfect. I would absolutely recommend this bar to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Willy Lo

customer_reviews.title: ... when I say this I am going to sound like "that guy" but the only knock that I have ...
customer_reviews.text: I know when I say this I am going to sound like "that guy" but the only knock that I have on it is that it doesn't fit enough weight. I am using the Rogue Fitness bumper plates, and I am only able to fit 3 45 pound plates on each side. Just a heads up for those out there using bumper plates. I am sure that you will be able to fit more weight on there if using conventional weights. Other than that the bar does it's job and I have been very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Chase

customer_reviews.title: All economical heads shall bow to the Cap Mega Hex Bar
customer_reviews.text: Holy Heaviness! This thing is monstrous in every way; not attractive due to the slipshod finish but highly functional with deep, effective knurling on the thick handles. The welds are thick like how we did them in welding shop, for extra strength and insurance; no cracks, it's all solid and beastly. For a hundred bucks this is definitely worth it. For some, the silver paint finish will be a deal breaker but I plan on painting mine black and getting busy.
customer_reviews.author: S. DEMILLE

customer_reviews.title: Love my new toy
customer_reviews.text: I have long legs & have rubbed my shins before with a regular bar. Also have a sciatica issue that hasn't allowed me to do squats without hurting for days, which has turned me off of doing them. This bar has been a dream for me. With this bar I can do deadlifts, farmers carry, & shoulder shurgs. The only pain I had was from using my leg muscles again (sore). No back pain which is a blessing. Love my new toy!
customer_reviews.author: carlos e. montoya

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty awesome way to get in your squats / deadlifts ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty awesome way to get in your squats / deadlifts at home! I absolutely love this thing... it doesn't hurt my lower back like a normal squat bar does. It is high quality and very affordable. It fits me perfectly (5 feet 9 inches approximately 160 lbs). Note: if you get 45 lbs plates to use with this then you might not be able to dig deep enough to really target those glutes (due to the bigger diameter). I decided I was going to purchase a bunch of 25 lbs plates instead.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great bar, minor surface rust but can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, solid, heavy bar (50 lbs). I really like the size of the tubing and the higher and lower handle positions. While this bar is not chrome plated and does have some very minor surface rust around some of the welds, it's nothing to be concerned about and can be addressed with paint or primer. The price for this was well worth it, especially if you don't consider chrome plating an absolute necessity and just want a bar that gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Otto

customer_reviews.title: Mehh
customer_reviews.text: Poorly welded. I went with the standard unpainted version and half the bar is silver the other half looks almost bronze. Came without a box only wrapped up in brown paper and tape that had almost disintegrated. Whole thing looks like someones high school welding project .Supposed to be rated up to 750lbs but I doubt it. The only positive things about this is that it does weigh 50 lbs and it does fit 2 inch plates. After whatever "paint" that's on it is removed it'll be fine for what I need it for so I'm not going to go through the hassle of returning it but it's definitely overpriced for what you're getting.
customer_reviews.author: Rodo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing mess
customer_reviews.text: Received today, in this condition. Scratched everywhere that I did remove the packaging. Black foam packaging material is stuck to the hand grips. It's a mess. So disappointed. Contacted manufacturer. Had to submit photos and receipt. Now it will be up to me to return this 53 lb item for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect info in Amazon description - 500lb weight limit
customer_reviews.text: Three stars for the price, if it cost any more, I'd return it. The bar is functional, but if you cross reference the product number with Cap's website it has a 500lb weight limit, not 1,000 lbs (maybe they'll fix this now). Mine seems slightly bent already with only 400lbs on it. The end sleeves where you load the weights had metal gobs on them that had to be filed down before I could slide weights on. The knurling is aggressive, but fine for heavy deadlifts, no chalk needed. Basically, you get what you pay for. Okay for garage gym, but overall not super happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Cup o Joe

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality control and coatings plus rough gnurl
customer_reviews.text: The coating on them is absolute garbage. It's cheap spray paint quality at best. I know a lot of reviews mention this and others dismiss it but I honestly didn't expect it to be this bad. My wife asked if I bought it used. Also it seems heavier than others. I have not weighed it yet but it feels off. The gnurl in the bars is really rough. I don't have soft hands and it was rough on me. My wife said she needed gloves. Here are a few pics minutes after unwrapping it.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy C.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time or money , Customer service sucks
customer_reviews.text: I got this equipment and it looked like a old hex bar that was dent, chipped and when I call CAP customer service I was made a lot of promise and I would have to constantly call to find out what’s going on with a replacement first the manager didn’t know what was going on in the warehouse and no one seemed clueless. I’m just trying to under stand why AMAZON does work with this company. Their customer service gets an -1 to the infinity’s power.
customer_reviews.author: Tb

customer_reviews.title: Great hex bar
customer_reviews.text: Great hex bar at a decent price. Some of the finish was rubbed off during shipping, but it doesn't matter much to me since it'll get banged up anyway. I've only had 300lbs on it so far, but it's solid and it stays balanced while sitting on the floor. This bar makes deadlifts more tolerable for me, as using a standard bar bothers my lower back with any amount of weight. I also like that it has 2 handle levels so that I can go deeper when I need to. Overall it's a great purchase and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: The item is brand new and already has rust on it. Literally the moment it came out of the package it had rust on it. I have owned it for all of about 24 hours. Every single weld has rust. Apparently they used a very poor coating on the item. It arrived with rust. Spend a few extra dollars and get a better one that won’t be rusty.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Should have read the reviews - buyer beware - works fine if you don’t want to add weights
customer_reviews.text: I always wait before leaving reviews to give a company a chance to help correct an issue. And very rarely leave reviews unless something is well above or bellow expectations. Product is fine and would get the job done but arrived with tons of paint chips and scratches. My gym is outside under a Ramada and my concern is that all the chipped spots will soon rust. I reached out to the supplier and got zero response in 10 day’s now. Most companies at least respond to questions and try to help. There are dozens available in this price range pick a different brand. After no response I’ll be sending it back and getting one from someone else.
customer_reviews.author: PHWC

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. Rusted seams.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after deciding to start a home gym instead if paying monthly dues. I expected it to have scuffs, scratches, and imperfections. I could tell by the delivery packaging that mine would have plenty of them. I'm not looking to have it in a fashion show. What I didn't expect was to find multiple rusted areas at the welded seams. It's not something I want to see for a high weight exercise that involves my back.
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: LOVE having this for deadlifts
customer_reviews.text: LOVE having this for deadlifts, and squats! I feel a lot more confident using this that I won't bother my back, but can still squat and dead some heavy weight. The bar itself is HEAVY for me. I do add weight, but the bar itself is pretty darn heavy. For reference, I'm a woman and I"m 5'2. I have a small space and find it to be somewhat cumbersome. It either needs to have a place on the floor, or, I lean it against the wall but it's so heavy, and it basically rests on the end, the skinny bar, that I'm worried it'll topple over. But quality wise, awesome piece of equipment to have!
customer_reviews.author: Carre Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Great Hex Bar. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: If you want pure, functional fitness equipment then buy this bar. For around $100 you can't beat this for all around lower body fitness. Yes, you can spend $100-$200 more for something better looking or with fancy, spinning handles that you don't need but all you need is this basic bar. I've had it since May 2018, it's been left in the rain for a few weeks, got a little rusty. Who cares. I got the black one and I'll just paint it for summer. I use the low grip paired with Fat Gripz , my 16-year-old son uses the high grip and his soccer speed has definitely improved. Get this bar.
customer_reviews.author: BB13

customer_reviews.title: Moderate build quality and poor packaging which will result in shipping damage
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the black unit. As others have stated, the packaging is subpar and no surprise my unit arrived with scratches, chipped paint, rust, etc. It's still completely usable but I didn't find that reasonable. The build quality is moderate. For example the handles are not square and the knurling is not uniform. Note if you have bumper plates you will only be able to load three 45 lb plates per side and that is without space for a clamp, and the bar does not have rotating collars, if that matters to you. That being said, I find the bar is perfectly usable. I contacted Amazon and I agreed to keep the bar for a discount of 25%.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford G.

customer_reviews.title: SHAME ON YOU!! DON'T BOTHER TO BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: SHAME ON YOU!! DON'T BOTHER TO BUY!! I received my black trap bar looking like it was rusting away in the rain. The paint is chipping everywhere with rust all over. It's unfortunate that you would even consider sending/selling this to anyone. Look at the pictures, see for yourself. Didn't want to select any starts for this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Diana C

customer_reviews.title: Great bar!
customer_reviews.text: Great bar. Haven’t had a ton of weight on it as I generally use it for higher rep deadlifts but it’s taken some heavy use pretty well. These bars are very versatile and I’m glad I bought it. I’m 6 foot tall so the extra handle length that are found on some of the more expensive bars isn’t necessary. Overall I’m very pleased and this has really stepped up my workouts.
customer_reviews.author: David Williams

customer_reviews.title: Just about perfect (almost)
customer_reviews.text: I love hex bars. This one is by CAP and obviously quality.. I only have a small gripe about it which is that they didn't create it with level bars going across where the raised ones are. The handles are either raised or very low if upside down. It isn't a huge issue but I would have loved to have had those level handles for a similar range of motion to a barbell. The knurlijg isnoretty aggressive, for heavy weight I have to use gloves to prevent my hands from getting torn up (I'm a massage therapist and need to limit calluses to the nor al ones from lifting). All in all a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Came with major scratches and defects.
customer_reviews.text: I understand its a hex bar and it will have wear put on it. However it shouldnt already come with all this wear on it when i paid full price for it new. Im definetly dissappointed in the shape it came in but what can ya do since shipping was free and its 50lbs and i dont want to pay to ship it back. C'mon even the foam padding to protect it was all stuck to the bar. I had to take abount an hour to clean it all off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's hard to beat the price/value on these trap bars
customer_reviews.text: I have the same plain steel trap bar and. Y suggestion is to get that one. The colored/painted ones come beat up and paint chipped from shipping so they look banged up. It's hard to beat the price/value. My plain steel one has held up well over the last few years and has no problem holding 500 plus lbs. The ends for plate loading are not as long so if you are only using bumper plates you might only get 500 lbs depending on the thickness of your bumpers but you can get closer to 700ish total (using thinner 45 lb plates). For the price when on sale it's definitely a 5 star value
customer_reviews.author: ira_est_a_donum

customer_reviews.title: Wet Paint, but solid Construction
customer_reviews.text: The bar it self is excellent. Absolutely no complaints as far as construction. Why am I reading this only three stars? Because of False advertising.. I quote.."Each of CAP’s Customized Trap Bars is coated in the USA by Accu-Coat, Inc." I received my bar and it was still wet. Apparently the accucoat is no more than a $6 can of silver spray paint bought at Home Depot. I mean if I wanted to look like the Tin Man from Wizard of Ozz, I would have saved the $90 and bought a can of silver paint for $6.
customer_reviews.author: Maxx

customer_reviews.title: Black is paint not anodized
customer_reviews.text: Number 1 the packing was terrible as it was destroyed upon arrival and when I saw that the bar was painted, not only did it look bad but my bumper plates would not fit over the increased diameter bar end due to the build of the paint. I know this because my black body solid 7' bar receives the plates perfectly. Waste of energy having to return this nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: PublicName

customer_reviews.title: A good Hex bar... exactly what you'd find at the gym
customer_reviews.text: Nothing more to say other than: good product for the price. Range of motion and the build of the product is sound. However, I paid money for a NEW product; this was used and covered (almost 90%) in dirt and rust. Thus, it gets ONE star for presentation.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Rothstein

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre bar with very inconsistent knurling
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting too much for the price, but wow, the knurling on one of the 4 handles is very aggressive compared to the other 3. The black painted finish is chipped off in a number of places too. Luckily I won't be using this bar that much and it will get the job done, but fairly disappointed in the quality control of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Dual handle cap mega olympic trap bar (75 pounds)
customer_reviews.text: The cap barbell mega olympic trap bar with dual handles is a beast of a trap bar, this thing is solid, fits regular olympic plates and olympic bumper plates, knitting is not aggressive but is enough to be useful, double handles for extra variety, and the fact it already weighs 75 pounds ( give out take a pound or two, always seems to be that way nowadays) is great because without even putting a plate on, you already have a decently heavy bar, If you’re looking for an affordable tap bar this is it, it’s quality is great and you can always find cap equipment sale’s.
customer_reviews.author: RICK L.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, Solid, Looks like crap
customer_reviews.text: I know this is a functional piece of equipment so looks shouldn't matter. However, the bar I received looks like it was dragged here behind the truck delivering it. It was wrapped in plastic and tape and appeared like it would be in pretty good shape. After opening, the knurling on the handles looks like its been scraped off from dragging and the offset handles are crooked. REALLY CROOKED. It does hold the weight but I am incredibly disappointed in the build quality of this bar. I wish I would've spent a little more for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Truly a Mega Bar
customer_reviews.text: Actually purchased this one for the neutral grips. Did not pay much attention to the weight. Obviously the title should have given it away but didn't ring a bell. It truly is a mega bar. The weight is roughly 75 pounds. So make sure which one you get. As far as design, function and looks this thing is a rock star. Came with a couple nicks in the paint/powder coating but who cares. It looks like you have been using it. Definitely recommend this bar for anyone wanting a Hex bar. I get a great workout, without any of the stress on my back from traditional squats.
customer_reviews.author: Hollywood

customer_reviews.title: Awful quality control and packaging received damaged, useless product
customer_reviews.text: Manufacturer needs to stand behind product and issue a refund! I received this item with such a big gouge on over side that I can't even get any weight plates on that side of the bar. Very disappointed as I now have a useless item. UPDATE 4/3/2020: Company would not stand behind product and issue refund or replacement, will never buy another product from them again and suggest you don't either!
customer_reviews.author: MRB

customer_reviews.title: Very Basic, but fitting plates is an Issue
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hexbar to practice for the new ACFT but the components on the end are very short. You'll max out with number of plates you can put on before you probably max out your 1RM. The packaging was also terrible; it came scratched up, dented, and with chips taken out of it. It's a weight bar, it doesn't need to look pretty but showing up damaged was a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: YellowBrickRoad18

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality, can’t beat the price point.
customer_reviews.text: First off this bar functions just as I expected. Great for squats, deadlifts, shrugs, farmerwalks etc. I use cast weights so I don’t have some of the issues other reviewers had with using bumper weights. Slightly disappointed in the black finish though. I was expecting somewhat of higher quality. It literally looks spray painted which is OK don’t get me wrong but I was expecting more of a powder coating finish. But for the price and functionality you can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I paid for a new bar and instead got a used one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid and effective
customer_reviews.text: Mine came in protective packaging. No damage on shipping. Weighs 50 lbs. The bar is symmetrical and balanced. Olympic weights fit snug but not difficult to put on. Range of motion is what you'd expect from a shrug bar. I use for both shrugs and squats. I can no longer do regular squats with the bar behind my neck due to a shoulder injury. This is a great solution. I went with the chrome bar based on other negative reviews about the black chipping off.
customer_reviews.author: Randy K.

customer_reviews.title: Only raised handles.
customer_reviews.text: This bar is good. The quality of workmanship is good. Had I done a better job of investigating the product I would have discovered there is only one set of handles. My bad. The packaging began to fall off. Understandably, given the awkwardness of the item and the circuitous route. The shipping was positively atrocious ! It started in my state, traveled to another state, came back, went to yet another state, then hit two other cities before finding mine. Two day shipping turned into two weeks. (Sad Face)
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend paying more for another manufacturer if you're going to ...
customer_reviews.text: Serves it's purpose. Technically it is "rackable", but you must be careful. In my rack with 2 Olympic plates & collars it is a tight fit. If you're not paying attention, it will throw off your balance when tying to rack heavy weight. Also, when I got mine one of the handles was slightly crooked. Not enough to send back, but noticeable. Would recommend paying more for another manufacturer if you're going to seriously and consistently use it. I'm considering replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. Knurled grips will cut you.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, it’s just a hundred bucks so I expected some quality issues. The welds are not the cleanest and the rubber cushioning from the packaging sticks to the bar in many places. The biggest issue is the knurled grips are sharp especially at heavier weights beyond 250 lbs. They will cut your hands. Even if you are a manly man with big strong calloused hands. The solution would be to use some ebony cloth sandpaper and knock down the sharp bits. Remember, it’s a hundred bucks.

customer_reviews.title: Fits a lot of plates, future proof, but very heavy
customer_reviews.text: The mega version is extreme. The thing is 73 pounds and has 13 inch sleeves which can fit 7 plates per side. So far I’ve managed to lift 490 pounds, shown in the video I posted, and there’s plenty of room left. The finish is fine for the price. The Knurling is very uneven but aggressive and sufficient. The only downside is that because the bar itself is so heavy, you won’t look as awesome on instagram ;) you’ll have to subtract a plate from whatever you normally do.
customer_reviews.author: Y T

customer_reviews.title: Great bar.
customer_reviews.text: Built like a tank. I can't find anything wrong with it. Heard complaint s about welds breaking but I see no possibility of that on mine. Welds look good. I use cheap Olympic Ironman plates and had no trouble with them fitting on. I've read done higher grade number plates with very exact specs have trouble fitting but I had no issues. My collars also fit on and held.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great.
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a brand new hex bar and its black, which made this desirable. But some flaws revealed itself. The packaging was awful, but I think I figured it would be okay because it may be durable to dings or even drops. I found out that there were a few scratches in the paint revealing some bare metal. Lastly, I noticed that the handles were off/crooked. I whipped out the measuring tape and sure enough, it's off by a little bit. Overall, it's a good bar and looks sleek with the black, but it isn't great. Some clamps may not fit, which may scratch the paint off so do be careful there as well.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Overall good,  with some issues
customer_reviews.text: Most of the welds are of very good quality, and the others are still ok - functionally strong but some minor cosmetic issues. The only real criticism I have is that the handles are not fully parallel with one another. One side is square to the axis of the weight bar, but the other side is quite out of square. I don’t expect it to have a significant impact on performance, but it certainly is not correct.
customer_reviews.author: VM120

customer_reviews.title: Great DEADLIFT Bar
customer_reviews.text: I give it five stars for it does everything it's supposed to do. Pros Range of motion High Handles aren't too high Easier on the lumbar spine Can target either legs or back by modifying bar path Neutral handles lowering probability of bicep tears Versatile if you're creative Cons The weight limit if you're a very serious lifter. Paint chips with use Still overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: mattattack731

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous and defective bar
customer_reviews.text: One of the handles on the hex bar is canted inward. One of your hands will always primate inward rather than having both hands in a neutral grip. This is unsafe for heavy weigh and will cause muscle imbalances and possible shoulder impingement. How did my bar get passed QC? I’d ask for an exchange but I don’t want to have to pay for shipping and also wait for a replacement. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Warped and knurling issues
customer_reviews.text: The bar itself is "fine" for lifting, but it is noticeably warped after 450lb deadlifts, and not from dropping it or slamming it....controlled descent. Knurling on one handle is missing from about 1/3 of the handle. I can still use the bar as it is, which is why it will have 2 stars, but it's definitely not a quality piece of equipment due to the issues noted above and I will eventually be replacing it because the warping is bothersome to me to see.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Michaud

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad, but dmg and handles are not quite plumb
customer_reviews.text: It came in fairly poor packaging with some rust, dings, and the handles may not be straight vertically (one was 1/4inch lean in and other 1/4 inch lean out). The horizontal bar was close to plumb, assuming my concrete floor is level. I don’t think the minor rust or slight issue with handles are much of a concern. They definitely could do a little better in protecting packaging and squaring things up.
customer_reviews.author: darrick

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Welds are ugly and sloppy. Metal pieces were sticking out on the handles. That really hurt first time lifting them. I filed them down but that took some time. Overall you can add weight to it and pick it up so I guess it does its job. I would not buy this again, and would instead invest more money in a better quality product. The knurling is not consistent at all. The left side is rough and the right side is smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer90

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent! DOES NOT Fit Bumper Plates Completely
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this off Amazon bc all of the reputable brands are sold out (Rogue, Titan, etc....). Happy to have something quickly that works, but I wish I waited. The bars aren't flush and so standard Rogue bumper plates dont fit completely. There is a 2-3 inch gap on one side and a 1-2 inch gap on the other side. It'll work, but super disappointing to see the inconsistency of construction. Sturdy? Yes. Cheaply made? Yes. Will it work? Sure...
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: OB-89HB hex bar
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty sturdy, should do the job it is intended for. The knurling is not uniform, one of the handles seems to be off center and the finish is rubbed/scraped of in many places. CAP's quality control could use some attention....maybe produce the item in the USA! Amazon adds nothing to the factory packaging to help protect the product in shipping yet another thing that Amazon has let go to the wayside.
customer_reviews.author: LJNAPPER

customer_reviews.title: 72lbs.  Outstanding value.
customer_reviews.text: It's 72lbs. Absolutely rock solid. Cheaply made but who cares for $60. Gets the job done at an unbeatable value. Perfect size. Good grips. Small sharp metal barbs here and there I just filed off. And it was dirty so I cleaned it But again.. great deal especially considering shipping something so heavy and akward. Just remember it's 72lbs. Heavy!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Tall people
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'5" and this bar works for me. I do not hit my legs or knees. The knurling is aggressive. All the welds look ok. The finish is fine for a $100 bar. It weighs 73 lbs. The Rogue bar looks amazing but this is way more "bang buck" in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Neal

customer_reviews.title: This bar will be around long after I'm gone.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for squats and shrugs and this bar is beyond what I'd expected. I am more than happy at how solid and heavy this thing is and the grips are better than sandpaper and gorilla glue. Needless to say that I won't be chalkin' it. If you're doing serious weight, I think you'll love this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Lamonde

customer_reviews.title: Good bar for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bar for the price. The only issue i have is similar to what others have said. It comes with much finish damage, reference my pictures. The packing used to protect the bar is not adequate to protect the areas that are contacted every time the bar is moved. The bar is heavy and so i'm sure it gets put down heavily each time it is moved and the coated finish does not hold up well. Other than that it is a good bar for the price.
customer_reviews.author: F. Beitler

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Spent a long time debating best product and best value. Got this at a good price, and glad I did. After two months, the grips are wearing out. Have since seen others with better-formed grips, some with rubber covers. Might've gone that way if I'd seen it for the same price as these. Still, a solid choice if you can find it on sale. (Mine also came partially damaged in the mail. Scratches don't bother me.) Separate tip: get the collars that snap on/off. I wasted money on the old school kind before realizing there had to be a better way.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price but there's one flaw...well two.
customer_reviews.text: The bar is big, solid and the grips are slightly higher (good for me) than the smaller Cap Hex bar I had previous to this one (the 750lb capacity model). The flaw is with the symmetry of those raised handles. They are not straight, and each handle is not even "off" in the same way. They are like twins that don't look alike. This crookedness(?) did not affect my lifting. I was able to center myself and align my arms to get the job done. It just bothers my aesthetic sense and informs my opinion of Cap's manufacturing precision.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 problems with this bar 1) it is out of flat(does not sit flat on ground by its self. 2) there is some kind of residue on the bar that I needed to clean off. 3) there is weld spatter from the mig welds in random places. It’s part of the weld process but typically a welder would take the time to clean off the spatter as they are sharp and can cut your hands. I would recommend having a file and sand paper on hand to remove it yourself. All in all it’s about what I would expect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Horne

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: This trap bar is great! It's a much better way to do deadlifts if you're dealing with a lower back injury or to avoid injury in the first place. Shipping was very fast, the price and quality are excellent as well. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: very good quality bar
customer_reviews.text: i got this for only $65 which was a steal to begin with but, this thing is a monster. i weighed it and it is 75 lbs like the page stated. very sturdy and well made. it has an aggressive knurl which i like i have used many bars that you can't even hold on to without straps the knurl was so weak. i would buy again at twice what i paid these are way nicer than the 45 pound cheaper made ones.
customer_reviews.author: shawn a

customer_reviews.title: CAP Hex Bar - Should work fine, would worry if I lived in a humid climate
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have noted, the packaging is insufficient to protect the product, despite a noble effort. The item arrived wrapped in stretch wrap, with foam and cardboard protecting most of the bar. However, several scrapes are present and go to bare metal, so if you're concerned about rust, this will be a problem. I'll probably lightly oil those spots, which is fine for my low-humidity environment, but this might be a deal-breaker if you live somewhere hot and humid.
customer_reviews.author: LGray

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty, but Absolutely Horrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: This could have been a nice bar, but all four of the handles were not welded on straight. If the manufacturer uses welding fixtures, they certainly do not know how to use them. The handles were also not centered. One handle was one inch closer to plates than the other side. It pretty much looked like a blind ten year old welded the thing together. I did not trust a replacement, so it was returned for a refund. I will never purchase another Cap Product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Deadlift

customer_reviews.title: This bar is great because it's centers the load on my spine rather ...
customer_reviews.text: It came a little rusty but honestly, who cares. This is a lot of equipment for what you're paying. If you pray to the iron Gods, the rust won't impact your deadlifts. This bar is great because it's centers the load on my spine rather than in front of it. I've had surgeries to repair herniated discs and decided that traditional deadlifts were no longer worth it for me. There's also some interesting research that shows centering the load using one of these hex bars helps develop power more quickly than the traditional deadlift. Buy the bar
customer_reviews.author: alex D

customer_reviews.title: Cap-able
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Utility - Holds plates really well Ergonomics - knurling on the handles is grippy without being sharp Cons: Finish - The finish is easily marred Closing thoughts: I like using this trap bar. At 75 lbs it's convenient to calculate the total loaded weight. The finish doesn't seem like it will hold up well, but it's meant to be used not looked at. It can hold a lot of weight and works great for my dead-lifts. I bought and used tornado J-hooks to mount my trap bar on the wall. I recommend that as a storage solution.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S

customer_reviews.title: Legit trap bar
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME. I started doing trap bar deadlifts 2 years ago because a Gym I was going to had it. I prefer training at my house now so have missed this and bought it. I didn't expect it to be as good as the one at the Gym but its honest to God BETTER. The pic doesnt do it justice. This is a super legit trap bar that could easily be found at any commercial gym. Very well made. I absolutely love it
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Well, what do you want for $100?
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the original finish, which appears to be chrome plated, but it's silver spray paint...that is half heartedly sprayed on the bar and immediately comes off all over your hands. Packaging was sparse at best and came scratched and dirty. The welds have a lot of splatter, and it looks like this was used to teach someone how to weld. But, it was only a hundred bucks. So as long as the welds hold, (which they appear that they will) I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Erik the Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Fits 6 standard 45lb plates
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bar. 75 lbs, plus it will fit 6 standard 45lb plates per side. This was most important to me since the vast majority of other trap bars in this same price range had significantly smaller loadable area. Knurling is aggressive but not terrible and the handles themselves are slightly larger diameter than a standard barbell, which is nice. great tool. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sure this this was spray painted
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure this this was spray painted. Before I even opened the package the black coating was flaking off leaving large patches of “coating” missing from various places on the bar. The kernelling was about what I expected from a $100 bar, not awesome. For my garage gym it will get the job done. I would buy this again for the price it’s offered at with free Prime shipping but I would not get a color coated bar. It’s a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Cap Deadlift Bar
customer_reviews.text: This bar has many names and uses but I am using it for both rehab deadlifting and safety. It is the perfect size and balance to use for safe deadlifting; it balances the weight perfectly along the axis of the spine and the thighs, and there is not much direct pressure against the lower back. It has sturdy knurled and raised handles which provide a great angle to lift with, and is clean, shiny and an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M

customer_reviews.title: good enough
customer_reviews.text: packaging was really awful when it arrived. maybe it survived the zombie apocalypse. the bar does its job despite that and the soldering not being as perfect as rogue would do, but i wasn't about to spend rogue prices. the important thing is that it's even, sturdy, the plates fit and it does the job. oh--the gnurling is rough so prepare for that. mind over matter. gloves are not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Elise A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: so good..
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good... It does what a trap bar should do. It's heavy (i need to re-weigh it, but i think it was 35lbs?). It has enough inside space to walk with it (Farmer's carry) and if I set it in the J-hooks on my rack, I can turn sideways in it and do dips in it. And when my bulging disc is acting up, I can use it for deadlift and get some relief. For my usage, it's great... did get a few rust spots quicker than expected, but it's in my garage in a humid climate, so no deductions there. I can work the rust off.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Mixed
customer_reviews.text: Solid trap bar. Due to lack of packaging, the bar was pretty scratched up. The black powder coat was completely gone in some areas. The bar is sturdy. All of my other bars are from rogue. This appears to be of similar quality. In hindsight I wish I would have paid the extra money to have the extended sleeves. If you have number plates you cannot fit much weight on. Also, the sleeves are not equally cut so I can load more weight on one side. The paint being scratched and chipped causes a concern about rust.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good value hex bar
customer_reviews.text: My bar weighs about 51lbs. Came with minimal cardboard in heavy shrink wrapping. Those being pretentious about the packaging, chipped coating, and rusty welds need to get a life. It does what it is supposed to and will last a lifetime if you don't keep it outside in the rain. Only complaint is the grips are a bit too wide but getting used to it
customer_reviews.author: MichoRizo

customer_reviews.title: RUSTED.
customer_reviews.text: Ship well packaged, in foam and cardboard while shrink-wrapped but upon opening what are the main Wells is considerably rusted it’s been rusting for a while. I guess you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment for the money!
customer_reviews.text: The hex bar showed up to my house with a few minor cosmetic flaws, but it's an otherwise sturdy and worthwhile investment. Cons: scratched finish, unnecessarily aggressive knurling, sleeves are too short for massive amounts of weight with bumper plates, and one end of the bar is thicker than the other (plates/bumpers are a very tight fit on that side). Pros: great price, fast shipping, very sturdy, and is a great addition to my home gym.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great bar, great price
customer_reviews.text: Loving this bar (75lb). The heavier bar weight means fewer plates to buy. The range of motion is perfect and my shins and lower back are thanking me. Great price. My only gripe is the scratching on the D handles. It looks like the bar was dragged during some point and the black coating scratched off in those areas. It was wrapped, but those areas of packaging were worn through.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Mom

customer_reviews.title: Razor sharp edges that cause deep cuts - handle with thick gloves!!!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This bar is poorly made and has lots of razor sharp edges. You'll cut yourself just unwrapping it. How can Amazon sell something like this? Total waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Um. Could I have one without rust everywhere?🤦🏻
customer_reviews.text: I suppose this could be a great bar. Won’t get a chance to find out. As I excitedly opened the package to work on DL and farmers walk, I couldn’t believe how rusted up it was. It’s one thing if it’s just a couple of spots—I don’t need perfection—but it was everywhere. You almost have to laugh—I mean who sees this and says “yep, we will just package it up and ship it out”? Yeah I will definitely be returning this. Will add photos as soon as I can figure out how.
customer_reviews.author: Lifter

customer_reviews.title: Rusted!
customer_reviews.text: I know it was raining on the day I received my bar but it was rusted before that! I had to sand it off and was shocked that they would send it in that shape. I didn't send it back as it was structurally sound but very disappointed in its appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Bosic

customer_reviews.title: Poor product & a company that doesn’t stand behind it
customer_reviews.text: Bar looked scratched up & used, and the accompanying CAP weight plates made it worse. They & the bar were built so poorly that the black paint on the bar stripped off. Worst of all, their customer service basically just shrugged & said “sorry, can’t help ya, tough luck”.
customer_reviews.author: Jkeepgoing

customer_reviews.title: Back Saver
customer_reviews.text: This is the best deal I came across for a hex bar. I got the plain one as I don’t think a color is worth $100. Great for those with lower back pain when deadlifting or squatting. I feel this more in the glutes and Hammies with no lower back pain. Keep in mind a deadlift is really a pushing motion (pushing into the ground with your legs/glutes) and not a pulling motion (you shouldn’t be using your arms). This has helped me in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Desmet

customer_reviews.title: Garbage poorly welded, residue
customer_reviews.text: scam, I don’t even think Cap created this, I received it and there is all sorts of residue on my hands. It was poorly welded. I should’ve known better for 100 bucks
customer_reviews.author: Trufitness617

customer_reviews.title: For the most part I am impressed.
customer_reviews.text: The trap bar is exactly what is pictured and is everything you could really want in one. The only down side is when I unpackaged mine it was a little scuffed here and there which doesn't bother me to bad because eventually it will get scuffed up and it wasnt really that noticeable, but it was forsure there. Also, you most definitely need to wipe the bar down a couple times before using it unless you want your hands to be silver... I gave it a 4/5 review instead of a 5/5 becuase of those two reasons. All in all I would recommend buying this product
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Hudd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect condition
customer_reviews.text: This chrome raised handle bar came in perfect condition, no rust, no dings, excellently packaged, with plastic caps on end of bars for protection. The negative reviews caused me concern, but I am glad I ordered it. Used it today in power rack, easy to use, saves space and extremely heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: ScoreS2020

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected. So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Poor manufacturing and even poorer shipping. This bar came with half the packaging hanging off. Paint and knurling were both damaged. Upon removal of the remaining packaging I noticed the bar was crooked. The one handle was welded on an angle. This bar also has fixed ends. They do not rotate like an olympic barbell. Spend the extra money and buy a good bar. Also I am 6'4" and this bar felt very small.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received a bent and beat up bar
customer_reviews.text: Do not cheap out and get this bar like I did. I received it in awful shape. The handles are not straight, the bar is angled, and the entire thing was stuffed up chipped coating etc... And it's not like the shipping process was to blame, because it is very clear that it was welded together wrong so it's obviously extremely cheaply manufactured. Now I am stuck having to ship them back this heavy awkward paper weight at my own expense!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid product made of good steel with a really awesome price
customer_reviews.text: Solid product made of good steel with a really awesome price. I have bumpers at home and the max this hex bar can fit is 3 - 45lbs bumpers on each side (315lbs). Only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I had to sand down the handles. Some metal fragments were a little rougher than usual on the handles. These rough fragments are not sharp enough to cut your hand but certain were an inconvenience. Easy fix. Either wear gloves or spend 2 mins per handle sanding them down. Overall, I would buy this product again and recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremey Amante

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great bar. Works like it should and didn’t break the bank which is always a good thing. When it arrived some of the black paint was chipped off but that’s more of a problem for the shipping company. Don’t expect a high end anodized bar for $100. I assume it’s just painted so if not handled properly can chip off. But it is not a big deal because it’s just in my room. I can always repaint if I want it to look perfect. Overall a great bar and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Torrey J.

customer_reviews.title: Helps this older guy deadlift more safely and stay strong
customer_reviews.text: I'm of an age where I'm most interested in staying functionally strong. I still push myself but I've got to be more conscious of proper form and preventing over-use injuries. This trap-bar was just what the doctor ordered. It freed me up to continue dead-lifting, but using a form that beats me up a little less. And it's allowed me to add farmer's walks to my regimen, and that's been a great addition. It's not the prettiest bar nor the most finely-machined, but for how I work out and the relatively lower amount of weight I lift now, it's great. A lot of bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: deaf-and-dumb

customer_reviews.title: Great bar
customer_reviews.text: I got the OB-91HZ trap bar, it weighs 73.8lbs. Looks like it can hold about (10) 45lbs plates on each side with spring clips. Kind of weird feeling at the end of the exercise movement, feels like it forces you to hip hinge? Anyways its a great bar. I tested it with 300lbs and my friends 16yo kid added 70lbs and lifted it once, never doing a deadlift before. lolol
customer_reviews.author: A. Gift For You

customer_reviews.title: but does the job at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive, but well made bar. All the welds are well made and relatively clean and the bar was level and balanced. The two handle positions allow you to vary the depth of a squat or dead lift. The finish is sufficient for a gym environment and should last for many years, especially if kept dry. It's not fancy, but does the job at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Tychell

customer_reviews.title: I always hated leg day until I got this hex bar
customer_reviews.text: My fav piece of equipment! I always hated leg day until I got this hex bar, now its my fav day of the week... The bar is super sturdy and saves my lower back and shins when deadlifting. In three months I've added 2 in to my legs and 100lbs to my deadlift. I've always fought my lower back in doing anything since I was a child and I can't express to you how much this bar changed my workouts. I can work my legs hard without all the stress on my back; get this bar, focus on technique and add the weight and you will see results! 10 stars if I could...
customer_reviews.author: Jace M.

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: This bar is a tank. I've used it hundreds of times over the past year and there are barely any signs of wear. No rust on the handles, no bending, minimal chipping on the collars. Its 75 lbs too which has been helpful while sourcing more weight. Any 2 inch olympic plate will work and i've used several from different brands.
customer_reviews.author: Collegecustomer123

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: This trap bar is pretty solid for what it is (price point). Like few others wrote, it was a bit banged up from shipping, but I did not care. No spinning collars - you're not going to find those on a $130 bar. Some of the angles that are supposed to be 90 degrees are not at 90 degrees (at least on one side), but it's not a big deal. I will run out of plate room at some point, but it works great for now. This bar helped me start deadlifting again. For the price I got it for, I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: delivery delay but worth the wait
customer_reviews.text: After months of waiting and multiple emails from the vendor asking if I still want the item it finally arrived. The Hex bar is great and came in looking like new as it should. The only grip is you can get a stance as wide as I normally would but it still gives a great work out. I recommend to all if you can bear the wait time.
customer_reviews.author: Comrade Red

customer_reviews.title: Good budget bar
customer_reviews.text: Overall good bar, works as it should, like some reviews mentioned does feel unbalanced but I'm not putting more than three plates on it right now so not a real issue. In the end it does its job, have slammed it a couple times and no issues so far on the welds holding up, I like it and get a good pump with it. Would reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I hate waiting for a product as long as it took to get it. But for the price I took the chance. WORTH THE WAIT .Heavy Duty nicer then expected.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sip

customer_reviews.title: prop 65 cancer warning
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt say anything about the fact that in CONTAINS CANCER CAUSING ELEMENTS until it arrives with a giant yellow warning sticker! Should be listed in the description!
customer_reviews.author: Truton

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The bar arrived fast and was packaged well with cardboard protecting most of the bar. This thing is SOLID and the welds look strong. The finish isn't beautiful and there was quite a bit of rust on one of the welds but for the price, I can't really complain and don't really care. If the rust worsens or I'm tired of looking at it, I'll just take a wire brush and a can of spray paint to the bar. If you're looking to add a functional if not beautiful piece of equipment to your home gym without breaking the bank then buy this bar.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, terrible paint finish
customer_reviews.text: Terrible finish on product. Came with some sort of paint that gets all over clothes and hands and anything that touches it. Wouldn’t recommended unless you wipe it down with some degreaser or paint remover. Otherwise, solid build quality for price.
customer_reviews.author: SWEAT

customer_reviews.title: Came looking like crap. Rust/corrosion
customer_reviews.text: Came looking like a corroded piece of garbage I picked up at the dump. Really guys? This is shameful. Dirty and gross. Thanks a lot
customer_reviews.author: Katyglynn

customer_reviews.title: How Did I Live Without One of These?
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I didn't buy one of these sooner - I now rate this as an "essential" piece of lifting equipment. I highly recommend it. I got an unpainted one and the quality is great. Everything is straight and square, the welds are beefy and reliable, and the whole thing is build like a tank. The knurling is a aggressive, so I hit it lightly with some sandpaper. A very versatile piece of gym equipment. Great quality and very worth it.
customer_reviews.author: AM80

product_meta.title: CAP Barbell Olympic Trap Bar, Hex Bar, Shrug Bar, Deadlift Bar, Options Available
feature_bullets: Specs: Bar Dimensions: 56 Inches Length x 24 Inches Width x 5 Inches Height; Bar Weight: 52 Pound; Weight Capacity: 750 Pound
Quality: Made of Zinc Plated 25 Millimeter Solid Steel
FEATURES: Combines raised and flush neutral grips
PRO: For use with Olympic plates; Places a lighter load on the lumbar spine and is especially advantageous for those with lower back pain or discomfort

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
